description: An icy castle situated atop the highest mountain in the Drum Rockies. Currently serves as a medical facility under Dr. Kureha after being abandoned by King Wapol. The castle features perpetually open doors to accommodate snow birds cared for by Chopper.

keyEvents.title: Nami Meets Chopper
keyEvents.description: Nami awakens in Drum Castle after being cured and meets the talking reindeer Chopper for the first time.
keyEvents.significance: First significant interaction between a Straw Hat and Chopper in the castle.

keyEvents.title: Chopper's Devil Fruit Revealed
keyEvents.description: Dr. Kureha explains to Nami that Chopper ate the Hito Hito no Mi while in Drum Castle.
keyEvents.significance: Important backstory exposition about Chopper takes place in the castle.

keyEvents.title: Chase Through the Castle
keyEvents.description: Luffy and Sanji chase Chopper through Drum Castle, wanting to eat him as food.
keyEvents.significance: Showcases the layout of the castle through an extended chase scene.

keyEvents.title: Chopper Protects Castle Birds
keyEvents.description: Chopper transforms to Heavy Point to prevent Luffy and Sanji from closing a door, protecting baby birds nesting in the castle.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates Chopper's care for the castle's inhabitants and his role as protector.

keyEvents.title: First Recruitment Offer
keyEvents.description: Nami asks Chopper to join the Straw Hats as their doctor while inside Drum Castle.
keyEvents.significance: The castle serves as the setting for the beginning of Chopper's recruitment arc.

statusHistory.description: Operating as Dr. Kureha's medical facility

culturalSignificance: Drum Castle represents both the oppressive past under Wapol and the hopeful future under Kureha's medical stewardship. It serves as Chopper's home and training ground, making it central to his character development.

notableFeatures.description: Medical treatment rooms where Dr. Kureha treats patients, including Nami's recovery from Casha disease
The castle's front door remains perpetually open to accommodate snow birds cared for by Chopper
Various areas in the castle where baby birds nest, which Chopper protects

trivia: The castle's interior remains cold due to the always-open doors, but this doesn't bother the residents who are acclimated to Drum Island's winter climate.
Dr. Kureha converted the former royal castle into a medical facility and teaching academy after Wapol's departure.
